contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Ibigawa |JapaneseName= 揖斐川町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Ibigawa in Gifu Prefecture.png |Region= [[Chūbu region|Chūbu]] |Prefecture= [[Gifu Prefecture|Gifu]] |District= [[Ibi District, Gifu|Ibi District]] |Area_km2= 803.68 |PopDate= July 2011<ref name=GifuEstimate>{{cite web|title=岐阜県の人口・世帯数人口動態統計調査結果|url=http://www.pref.gifu.lg.jp/kensei-unei/tokeijoho/kohyoshiryo/jinko-jutaku/jinko/2011/jinko201108.data/H2308kohyo.xls|work=Gifu prefectural website|publisher=Gifu Prefecture|accessdate=September 11, 2011|language=Japanese}}</ref> |Population= 23,398 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees = 35 |LatitudeMinutes = 29 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 136 |LongtitudeMinutes = 34 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Tree= [[Japanese Zelkova]] |Flower= ''Prunus persica'' |Bird= |SymbolImage= Flag of Ibigawa Gifu.JPG |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= Takao Sōmiya |CityHallPostalCode= 501-0692 |CityHallAddress= Miwa 133, Ibigawa-chō, Ibi-gun, Gifu-ken |CityHallPhone= 0585-22-2111 |CityHallLink=[http://www.town.ibigawa.gifu.jp/ Town of Ibigawa] }} {{nihongo|'''Ibigawa'''|揖斐川町|Ibigawa-chō}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ibi District, Gifu|Ibi District]], [[Gifu Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On January 31, 2005 the former villages of [[Fujihashi, Gifu|Fujihashi]], [[Kasuga, Gifu|Kasuga]], [[Kuze, Gifu|Kuze]], [[Sakauchi, Gifu|Sakauchi]], and [[Tanigumi, Gifu|Tanigumi]] merged with Ibigawa, resulting in a nearly 20-fold increase in area. As of July 2011, the town has an estimated [[population]] of 23,398 and the total area is 803.68 km²<ref name=area>{{cite web|title=町の位置・地勢|url=http://www.town.ibigawa.lg.jp/cms/contents_detail.php?co=ser&frmId=379|work=Town of Ibigawa website|accessdate=9 August 2011|language=Japanese}}</ref> (up from 46.32 before the merger). ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} *[http://www.town.ibigawa.gifu.jp/ Ibigawa official website] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Towns in Gifu Prefecture]] {{Gifu-geo-stub}}
